ygData.subject: Re: Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: You forgot the fact that it is mainly inhabited by wood elves...and that Kithicor himself is a wood elf (and I couldn t get him to talk, either). And he hangs
ygData.messageBody:
You forgot the fact that it is mainly inhabited by wood elves...and that
Kithicor himself is a wood elf (and I couldn't get him to talk, either).
And he hangs out at a cabin with no door, and all those burned out
cottages...something happened in that zone at some point...I just don't know
what. There are also those named Orcs by HH that seem to be brothers, and
the fact that the Captain can be found on tracking, but not anywhere around
where he's supposed to be.

And to the guy talking about the spawn rate....there was a place there (I
don't do the /loc thing) that my group called the X-Roads. When your're
near the road, you can rest...but go down the road a bit, and there were
more Giant Scarabs and Spiders than you could hope to kill...I gained a lot
of levels there...


Ryndal
19th Bard
Cazic-Thule
-----Original Message-----
From: Elijah Meeker <elijah@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, July 12, 1999 3:30 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Kithicor


>From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>
>
>
>>> Ok, I'm going to have to ask for even more spoiler. :) I've been to
>
>...
>>The zone is probably great between levels 8 to about 15 mainly
>>because it's empty.
>...
>
>Okay, this was a great technical description of the Kithicor, although
there are things about it you
>only discover over time, the spawn is VERY quirky and particular, way more
than described.
>
>But I and many others are convinced this is not all there is to Kithicor.
There is story there, very
>odd and mysterious story. If you are looking for "Levelquest" this is NOT
your zone. If you are
>looking to gain an understanding of one of the weirdest zones in the game,
go spend some time in
>Kithicor. You can run through it a hundred times and not notice much, you
can spend a night hunting
>spawn spots and not notice much, but over time you will begin to notice
little odd things. Things
>which in of themselves don't seem like much, but collectivly are odd enough
to make you wonder.
>
>The behaviors of Ged and Luna??? (I forget her exact name BUT we all
believe it is not accidental
>that she has the moon reference in her name). We are quite sure they are
involved...and when she is
>parted from him for a while she *runs* back. What is the story behind that?
>
>Ghouls that stand upright (spotted one night).
>
>One minute Ged is standing there happily, the next moment, a
werewolf...(seen by a friend)
>
>One night I saw Luna?? run into a burned out house and a female zombie run
out.
>
>And why doesn't she speak?
>
>There appears to be references to Kithicors past in the History of Norrath.
>
>The undead army. It's not there all the time, but when it IS there, it's
just plain weird.
>
>*one* goblin? How often do you see a lone goblin? Not named, just a regular
ol' goblin. Is he lost?
>
>No music, no footsteps NOTHING. Just plain spooky. After some time there
walking out into W
>Commonlands feels like stepping into a cheery garden...The whole place,
from the merchants to the
>other residents to the locked buildings to the bizarre nature of the
spawn...The Truth is Out There.
>And you won't find it while leveling through...
>
>Tszaaz, Scarlet Moon
>
>
>
>
>
